entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin rudis; probably akin to Latin rudus rubble

def.dt: :being in a rough or unfinished state :crude
:primitive undeveloped peasants use rude wooden plows Jack Raymond
:marked by or suggestive of lack of training or skill :inexperienced rude workmanship
:occurring abruptly and disconcertingly a rude awakening

entry.pt: rude rough crude raw mean lacking in social refinement. rude implies ignorance of or indifference to good form; it may suggest intentional discourtesy rude behavior. rough is likely to stress lack of polish and gentleness rough manners. crude may apply to thought or behavior limited to the gross, the obvious, or the primitive a crude joke. raw suggests being untested, inexperienced, or unfinished turning raw youths into polished performers.
